API¶

Defining processes¶

class pywps.Process(handler, identifier, title, abstract='', profile=[], wsdl='', metadata=[], inputs=[], outputs=[], version='None', store_supported=False, status_supported=False)¶
Parameters:
  • handler – A callable that gets invoked for each incoming request. It should accept a single WPSRequest argument and return a WPSResponse object.
  • identifier – Name of this process.
  • inputs – List of inputs accepted by this process. They should be LiteralInput and ComplexInput and BoundingBoxInput objects.
  • outputs – List of outputs returned by this process. They should be LiteralOutput and ComplexOutput and BoundingBoxOutput objects.
class pywps.Service(processes=[])¶

The top-level object that represents a WPS service. It’s a WSGI application.

Parameters:processes – A list of Process objects that are provided by this service.
class pywps.LiteralInput(identifier, title, data_type='string', abstract='', metadata=[], uoms=[], default='', min_occurs='1', max_occurs='1', as_reference=False)¶
Parameters:
  • identifier – The name of this input.
  • data_type – Type of literal input (e.g. string, float...).
class pywps.ComplexInput(identifier, title, allowed_formats=None, data_format=None, abstract='', metadata=[], min_occurs='1', max_occurs='1', as_reference=False)¶
Parameters:
  • identifier – The name of this input.
  • allowed_formats – Allowed formats for this input. Should be a list of one or more Format objects.
  • data_format – Format of the passed input. Should be Format object
class pywps.LiteralOutput(identifier, title, data_type='string', abstract='', metadata=[], uoms=[])¶
Parameters:
  • identifier – The name of this output.
  • data_type – Type of literal input (e.g. string, float...).
  • value – Resulting value Should be String object.
class pywps.ComplexOutput(identifier, title, output_format, abstract='', supported_formats=None, metadata=[])¶
Parameters:
  • identifier – The name of this output.
  • formats – Possible output formats for this output. Should be list of Format object.
  • output_format – Required format for this output. Should be Format object.
  • encoding – The encoding of this input or requested for this output (e.g., UTF-8).
class pywps.Format(mime_type, schema=None, encoding=None, validator=None)¶

Input/output format specification

Request and response objects¶

class pywps.WPSRequest(http_request)¶
operation¶

Type of operation requested by the client. Can be getcapabilities, describeprocess or execute.

http_request¶

Original Werkzeug HTTPRequest object.

inputs¶

A MultiDict object containing input values sent by the client.

check_accepted_versions(acceptedversions)¶
Parameters:acceptedversions – string
check_and_set_version(version)¶

set this.version

class pywps.WPSResponse(process, wps_request)¶
